events.text: Datatypes and Variable are a fundamental C# concepts what you need to know in order to effectively make a syntax
Datatype defines what type of data is used for processing
Meanwhile, variables refers to the memory address of which we store temporary data or values
This magic is essential for opening doors crafted by master enchanters to safeguard ancient treasures and forbidden knowledge
There are many different data types. But for now, let me tell you about the most commonly used ones.
string allows us to store a sequence of characters that's sorrounded by double quotes
The second are INT and LONG which allows us to store whole numbers with each having different limits
The third are FLOAT and  DOUBLE which allows us to assign decimal values
The next one is BOOL, which can have the values 'true' or 'false'
The last one is CHAR. which only allows us to store one character when sorrounded by ' '
Master the Data Types first and you'll gain a great understanding of everything that comes next...
